Tryndamere, like a lot of the stat-check-y champs, is a relic of older design ideas that Riot's people had back in the day. There's admittedly something pretty inelegant about a champion just straight up not dying while he beats you down, but Tryn isn't the end all be all of problematic dudes.

I'm going to assume you're a new player and not a smurf, so let me tell you, there are some plenty of ways of dealing with him. Try out Rammus, Malphite, Teemo, Pantheon, and/or Renekton.

Also, calling for nerfs on something you dislike is the exact opposite of helpful. Just because you'll get loads of upvotes for making hate threads for specific champions doesn't make it a good idea.
alright i get what youre saying but when i see match history where everyone else on the enemy team has 2 kills or less and tryn has 27 i get a little cringed

Tryndamere is something of a pub-stomper at low levels (as well as low elo), much like Yi, RIven,Yasuo, etc. They get much better when a team doesn't know how to deal with them. And let me tell you, the answer to that is "hard cc and tanks." A lot of players don't really get that and make the mistake of trying to 1v1 them, which makes them get fed and then snowball out of control.

This is going to sound kind of shitty, but the problem isn't so much Tryndamere as it is the lack of knowledge and skill possessed by low level players. And don't worry, that'll come with time and practice.  But until then, if you'll have to find out how to counter these sorts of champions.

Think of your pre-30 levels as a learning experience. None of this matters. Go into each game, try to figure out what the most successful dude is doing, and see if you can stop him from doing that. That might take some research though, which I encourage heartily. Actually, you should also consider trying to replicate what those successful players are doing. Maybe.
